concept.title: Implementing Authorized Access Control for the Cache
concept.shortdesc: To use authorization for client/server systems, your client connections must be authenticated by their servers.

conbody.p: To set up authorized access control for the cache:

ol.li: Determine the degree of control you want over client access to the server cache

Program and configure the authorization plug-in:
Create an implementation of the
com.gemstone.gemfire.security.AccessControl interface
Program a public static method to return an instance of the class.
Program the init method to store all properties required by the AccessControl.authorizeOperation method at the time the client makes its connection to the server. Do as much work here as you can to save time on the individual authorizeOperation calls.
Program the authorizeOperation method to perform whatever pre- and post-operation authorization activities your application requires. The OperationContext has the OperationCode and a boolean indicating whether the call is pre-operation or post-operation. For all but function calls, you can filter the post-operation results to remove any data you do not want your clients to receive. Function calls can be allowed or disallowed only in their entirety.
Set the gemfire.properties uniformly on all servers to implement the plug-in:
For pre-operation calls, set security-client-accessor to the fully qualified name of the static method you programmed to return an instance of the class. Example: //Pre-op example where myAccessControl.create returns the // instance of AccessControl security-client-accessor=myAuthPkg.myAccessControl.create
For post-operation calls, set security-client-accessor-pp to the fully qualified name of the static method you programmed to return an instance of the class. //Post-op example where myAccessControl.create returns the // instance of AuthInitialize security-client-accessor-pp=myAuthPkg.myAccessControl.create

conbody.p: Your authorizeOperation method will be invoked before and/or after each client operation, as configured.
